item.title: Exxon, Chevron See China Gas Growth Even With Russia Link
item.description: Exxon Mobil Corp. and Chevron Corp. are bullish on China’s future appetite for liquefied natural gas even if Russia succeeds in adding another pipeline to the Asian nation.

item.title: Algeria Nears Deals With Exxon and Chevron in Shale Gas Push
item.description: Algeria is close to finalizing a deal with Exxon Mobil Corp. and Chevron Corp. to tap the North African nation’s vast gas reserves, including shale, for the first time, a senior official said.

item.title: Exxon, Chevron Surpass Estimates With Record Oil Production
item.description: Exxon Mobil Corp. and Chevron Corp. posted better-than-expected results after record oil production cushioned the impact of lower crude prices.

item.title: John Hess to Buy Iconic Toy Trucks From Chevron After Takeover
item.description: John Hess plans to buy back his family’s iconic toy truck business next year from Chevron Corp. after the oil giant bought his company this month.

item.title: US Allows Chevron to Restart Pumping Oil in Venezuela
item.description: The Trump administration has restored Chevron Corp.’s ability to pump oil in Venezuela, according to a person familiar with the matter.

item.title: US Allows Chevron to Restart Pumping Oil in Venezuela

item.title: Venezuelan Bonds Get a Boost Amid Signs of US Policy Easing
item.description: A high-profile prisoner exchange and reports of easing US restrictions on Venezuela’s oil sector are jolting the usually idle market for the South American nation’s dollar bonds.

item.title: Venezuelan Bonds Get a Boost Amid Signs of US Policy Easing
item.description: A high-profile prisoner exchange and reports of easing US restrictions on Venezuela’s oil sector are jolting the usually idle market for the South American nation’s dollar bonds.

item.title: Oil Steadies as Eased Venezuela Curbs Undercut Trade Talk Gains
item.description: Oil held steady as the US moved to restore Chevron Corp.’s ability to pump oil in Venezuela, undercutting gains driven by progress on international trade talks.
